name: All distribution links
queries: count(erlang_vm_dist_node_state * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster) rabbitmq_identity_info) OR vector(0)

name: Established distribution links
description: When a connection between a node and peer is established, the distribution link is considered to be `up`
queries: count(erlang_vm_dist_node_state * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster) rabbitmq_identity_info == 3) OR vector(0)

name: Connecting distribution links
description: When a new connection is exchanging information between the node and the peer the distribution link is considered to be `pending`
queries: count(erlang_vm_dist_node_state * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster) rabbitmq_identity_info == 1) OR vector(0)

name: Waiting distribution links
description: When a new connection is established and there is an existing connection between the node and the peer, this connection needs to wait for the initial connection to go down before it can become active. The distribution link is considered `up_pending`
queries: count(erlang_vm_dist_node_state * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster) rabbitmq_identity_info == 2) OR vector(0)

name: State of distribution links
queries: erlang_vm_dist_node_state * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Data buffered in the distribution links queue
description:
Data currently buffered in the output queue of the distribution link.

Any values above the 64MB threshold hint to an overloaded distribution. This applies to the default `zdbbl` value in RabbitMQ, which is 128MB.

- [RabbitMQ Runtime Tuning - zdbbl](https://www.rabbitmq.com/runtime.html#distribution-buffer)
- [erl +zdbbl](http://erlang.org/doc/man/erl.html#+zdbbl)
queries: erlang_vm_dist_node_queue_size_bytes * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Data sent to peer node / s
queries: rate(erlang_vm_dist_send_bytes[60s]) * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Data received from peer node / s
queries: rate(erlang_vm_dist_recv_bytes[60s]) * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Distribution messages sent to peer node / s
description:
Number of inet packets sent to the distribution link port.

If too few messages are sent and data sits in the port driver buffer, increasing the `inet_dist_connect_options` as well as `inet_dist_listen_options` buffer values will result in more stable throughput.
queries: rate(erlang_vm_dist_send_cnt[60s]) * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Distribution messages received from peer node / s
description:
Number of inet packets received from the distribution link port.

If too many messages are received, increasing the `inet_dist_connect_options` as well as `inet_dist_listen_options` buffer values will result in more stable throughput.
queries: rate(erlang_vm_dist_recv_cnt[60s]) * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Average inet packet size sent to peer node
description:
Corresponds to the average size of the argument passed to `gen_tcp:send/2` or equivalent.

Typically corresponds to TCP window size.

If TLS is used for inter-node communication, the `inet` packet size will be varied so that the system as a whole is both secure and performant.

`inet` packets larger than the TCP window will be split into TCP packets by the system kernel.

`inet` packets smaller than the TCP window _may_ be joined into TCP packets by the system kernel.

* [`inet` packet](http://erlang.org/doc/man/inet.html#packet)
queries:
(rate(erlang_vm_dist_send_bytes[60s]) * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info) / 
(rate(erlang_vm_dist_send_cnt[60s]) * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info)

name: Average inet packet size received from peer node
description:
Corresponds to the average size of the argument received from `gen_tcp:recv/2` or equivalent.

Typically corresponds to TCP window size.

If TLS is used for inter-node communication, the `inet` packet size will be varied so that the system as a whole is both secure and performant.

* [`inet` packet](http://erlang.org/doc/man/inet.html#packet)
queries:
(rate(erlang_vm_dist_recv_bytes[60s]) * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info) / 
(rate(erlang_vm_dist_recv_cnt[60s]) * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info)

name: Memory used by the port driver
description: The total number of bytes allocated for this port by the runtime system. The port itself can have allocated memory that is not included.
queries: erlang_vm_dist_port_memory_bytes * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Data in the port driver buffer
description:
The total number of bytes queued by the port using the ERTS driver queue implementation

Any values above a few KBs hint to an overloaded distribution
queries: erlang_vm_dist_port_queue_size_bytes * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Process state
queries: erlang_vm_dist_proc_status * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Messages in the process queue
description:
The number of messages currently in the message queue of the process

Any values above 0 hint to an overloaded distribution
queries: erlang_vm_dist_proc_message_queue_len * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Memory used by the process
description: The size in bytes of process memory. This includes call stack, heap, and internal structures.
queries: erlang_vm_dist_proc_memory_bytes * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_node, rabbitmq_cluster) rabbitmq_identity_info

name: Process reductions / s
description: The number of reductions executed by the process
queries: rate(erlang_vm_dist_proc_reductions[60s]) * on(instance, job) group_left(rabbitmq_cluster, rabbitmq_node) rabbitmq_identity_info
